intro: Ampliglossum varicosum, commonly known as the veined globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, velvety, orb-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed margins, and its stems are often covered in a thick, waxy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Ampliglossum varicosum is often found in rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
